page.title: 04Farming around Sedlescombe
page.content:
Approximately one third of this area is occupied by Hurst Estate which is a dairy and sheep farming enterprise. This consists of two dairy herds of about 120 head each and a flock of 200 to 300 ewes.
To the West lie small mixed farms including fruit farms which call on local casual labour at harvest time. The main crops of these are apples, pears and soft fruit.
Petley Wood is now partially cleared to parkland and a thriving deer farm has developed with a herd of over 200 animals.
There are also farms specialising in poultry, especially turkeys, and the raising of game birds.
